question0.ques_name: Use Euclid's division algorithm to find the HCF of 135 and 225?

question1.ques_name: Use Euclid's division algorithm to find the HCF of 38220 and 196?

data.step1: Divided (a) as dividend and keping (b) as divisor get remainer(r) and quotient(q), apply the value in Euclid's division lemma a = bq + r
data.step2: From the above equation take divisor (b), remainer(r) divide and get remainer(r1) and quotient(q1), now apply b=rq1+r1
data.step3: From the above equation take divisor (b), remainer(r) divide and get remainer(r2) and quotient(q2), now apply b=rq2+r2
data.step4: From the above equation take divisor (b), remainer(r) divide and get remainer(r3) and quotient(q3), now apply b=rq3+r3
data.step5: From the above equation take divisor (b), remainer(r) divide and get remainer(r4) and quotient(q4), now apply b=rq4+r3

feedback.postFeedback1: Since r is not equal to 0. Therefore the steps need to continue.
